content: Why do some confluence page get a URL with confluence.hl7.org/pages/viewpage.action?pageId= while others get confluence.hl7.org/display/{space}/{page-name} ?

@Paul Denning Generally speaking it has to do with the Characters in the title of the page. Confluence will use "pretty" format with the space/page-name unless the title of the page has special characters from this list: % & ? / \ ; " ยง + Additionally, there are tiny urls available for copy/paste from the page properties. If someone copies that it will not convert it and you'll see something like: https://confluence.hl7.org/x/OmT9Aw

What about https://confluence.hl7.org/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=104584082 ?
Looks like other characters may be special: ,()
for "Antatomic, Therapeutic and Chemical Classification (ATC)"
